refsynopsisdiv.title: Methods

refsect1.title: Signals
Properties
refsect1.synopsis: Connections readable ao Hostname readable s CanModify readable b

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The Settings interface allows clients to view and administrate the connections stored and used by NetworkManager.

refsect2.title: The ListConnections() method
refsect2.para: List the saved network connections known to NetworkManager.

refsect2.title: The GetConnectionByUuid() method
refsect2.programlisting: GetConnectionByUuid (IN s uuid, OUT o connection);
refsect2.para: Retrieve the object path of a connection, given that connection's UUID.

listitem.para: The UUID to find the connection object path for.

refsect2.title: The AddConnection() method
refsect2.programlisting: AddConnection (IN a{sa{sv}} connection, OUT o path);
refsect2.para: Add new connection and save it to disk. This operation does not start the network connection unless (1) device is idle and able to connect to the network described by the new connection, and (2) the connection is allowed to be started automatically.

listitem.para: Object path of the new connection that was just added.

refsect2.title: The AddConnectionUnsaved() method
refsect2.programlisting: AddConnectionUnsaved (IN a{sa{sv}} connection, OUT o path);
refsect2.para: Add new connection but do not save it to disk immediately. This operation does not start the network connection unless (1) device is idle and able to connect to the network described by the new connection, and (2) the connection is allowed to be started automatically. Use the 'Save' method on the connection to save these changes to disk. Note that unsaved changes will be lost if the connection is reloaded from disk (either automatically on file change or due to an explicit ReloadConnections call).

listitem.para: Object path of the new connection that was just added.

refsect2.title: The LoadConnections() method
refsect2.para: Loads or reloads the indicated connections from disk. You should call this after making changes directly to an on-disk connection file to make sure that NetworkManager sees the changes. (If "monitor-connection-files" in NetworkManager.conf is "true", then this will have no real effect, but is harmless.) As with AddConnection(), this operation does not necessarily start the network connection.

listitem.para: Array of paths to on-disk connection profiles in directories monitored by NetworkManager.

Success or failure of the operation as a whole. True if NetworkManager at least tried to load the indicated connections, even if it did not succeed. False if an error occurred before trying to load the connections (eg, permission denied).
Paths of connection files that could not be loaded.

refsect2.title: The ReloadConnections() method
refsect2.para: Tells NetworkManager to reload all connection files from disk, including noticing any added or deleted connection files. By default, connections are re-read automatically any time they change, so you only need to use this command if you have set "monitor-connection-files=false" in NetworkManager.conf.

refsect2.title: The SaveHostname() method
refsect2.para: Save the hostname to persistent configuration.

listitem.para: The hostname to save to persistent configuration. If blank, the persistent hostname is cleared.
A dictionary mapping property names to variant boxed values

refsect2.title: The "NewConnection" signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when a new connection has been added after NetworkManager has started up and initialized. This signal is not emitted for connections read while starting up, because NetworkManager's D-Bus service is only available after all connections have been read, and to prevent spamming listeners with too many signals at one time. To retrieve the initial connection list, call the ListConnections() method once, and then listen for individual Settings.NewConnection and Settings.Connection.Deleted signals for further updates.

listitem.para: Object path of the new connection.

refsect2.title: The "ConnectionRemoved" signal
refsect2.para: Emitted when a connection is no longer available. This happens when the connection is deleted or if it is no longer accessible by any of the system's logged-in users. After receipt of this signal, the connection no longer exists and cannot be used. Also see the Settings.Connection.Removed signal.

listitem.para: Object path of the removed connection.

refsect2.title: The "Connections" property
refsect2.para: List of object paths of available network connection profiles.

refsect2.title: The "Hostname" property
refsect2.para: The machine hostname stored in persistent configuration.

refsect2.title: The "CanModify" property
refsect2.para: If true, adding and modifying connections is supported.
